page.title: 04Toft Farm
page.content: Toft Farm,at Hanchurch,is owned and run by the Edwards'family.There are usually three men working on the farm. The two farm hands who help the farmer live in two workers cottages on the farm land,which were originally built for the Duke's men as part of the Trentham Estate.It is an arable farm of 310 acres with some animals.The breakdown of what is grown is as follows:30 acres Potatoes,100 acres Wheat,85 acres Barley,60 acres Oilseed Rape and 35 acres grass.The land,which is described as Cupar Marl,yields 3 tons wheat to the acre, 50 cwt barley to the acre and 15 tons potatoes to the acre.The grass carries 150 breeding ewes and there are 100 intensive beef cattle in the yards.The hours worked are 7.30am until 5.30pm in the winter,and longer hours in summer.
